c2: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it. - Gen. Douglas MacArthur
It is a big step to take another human life. It is not to be done lightly. - Lt. Col. Tim Collins
It is well that war is so terrible
d3: else we should grow too fond of it. - Gen. Robert E. Lee

c2: War is always a matter of doing evil in the hope that good may come of it. - Sir Basil H. Liddel-Hart
A man who won't die for something is not fit to live. - Martin Luther King Jr.
God fights on the side with the best artillery. - Napoleon Bonaparte
One cannot simultaneously prevent and prepare for war - Albert Einstein
Only the dead have seen the end of war. - Plato
The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing. - Edmund Burke
I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought
d3: but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones. - Albert Einstein

c2: We sleep soundly in our beds because rough men stand ready in the night to visit violence on those who would do us harm. - George Orwell
Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go. - T.S. Eliot
The starting point for the understanding of war is the understanding of human nature. - S.L.A. Marshall
War is fear cloaked in courage. - Gen. William C. Westmoreland
War is the science of destruction. - John S.C. Abbot

d3: fight like hell for the living. - Anonymous

c2: History does not long entrust the care of freedom to the weak or the timid. - Dwight D. Eiesenhower
You are remembered for the rules you break. Not the rules you follow. - Gen. Douglas MacArthur
